intro: Brickellia rapunculoides, commonly known as yellow brickellbush, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy appearance. Brickellia rapunculoides typically grows in open woods and along stream banks, thriving in well-drained soils.
